definition: to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: Jack dehorts me from visiting Israel.
sentences.chinese: 杰克劝阻我出访以色列。

sentences.english: I've not discouraged my daughter from going on the pill now that she's reached the age of discretion .
sentences.chinese: 我女儿已到达解事责任年龄，我不再劝阻她服避孕药。

sentences.english: He set off once more in spite of his friends' attempts to dissuade him.
sentences.chinese: 尽管朋友们都竭力劝阻，他还是再一次踏上了征途。

sentences.english: Most were intercepted by his wife, Laurene.
sentences.chinese: 大部分人都被他的妻子劳伦劝阻。

sentences.english: You'd better dissuade him from doing that.
sentences.chinese: 你最好劝阻他别那样干。

sentences.english: Against Maggie's entreaties, Tom signed his name.
sentences.chinese: 尽管玛吉劝阻，汤姆还是签了自己的名字。
在劝阻客户交叉销售和貌相。

sentences.english: Heart again to satisfying to hao tian to confess to identity, but are small excellent discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 心怡再次想向浩天坦白自己的身份，却被小优劝阻。

sentences.english: We are not even trying to dissuade them, Parr said.
sentences.chinese: 我们甚至还没有试图劝阻他们，帕尔说。

sentences.english: She hurriedly set GuQing calls his team not to save HeiMu Jiao down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 她连忙集合队伍不顾青叔的劝阻要下山救黑木蛟。

sentences.english: Teachers should discourage their students from smoking and drinking.
sentences.chinese: 教师应劝阻学生吸烟喝酒。

sentences.english: We are still working to try to dissuade the North Koreans.
sentences.chinese: 我们仍在努力设法劝阻北韩人不要这样做。

sentences.english: But Xie was used to this kind of discouragement.
sentences.chinese: 但是解海龙对这样的劝阻已经习以为常。

sentences.english: The queen tried to dissuade him, but in vain.
sentences.chinese: 王后试着想加以劝阻，但依然无效。

sentences.english: Her piano teacher discouraged her from the instrument saying she was not gifted.
sentences.chinese: 她的钢琴老师曾劝阻她不要学琴，说她没有天分。

definition: to curb/to put a stop to/to stop/to check/to limit
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
to shout at sb to stop
earnest and well-meaning advice (idiom); to persuade patiently
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to be determined to/to insist on
